name: Shores Resort and Spa

reviews.text: Transportation: I arrived at Daytona Airport. The taxi to the resort was around $30 and the ride took 20 minutes. For those driving, there is a parking lot in front of the hotel.
reviews.title: Business Trip - expected a lot more

reviews.text: Arrival: I was expecting a front desk and was confused where to check-in. There are two podium-like stands on the right as you come in and that's where you check-in. Check-in was quick and efficient.
reviews.title: OK but Daytona Beach aint great

likes.disliked: — Poor service from parking valets, bellmen, and housekeeping

reviews.text: Room: The room was well decorated and had a comfy/tropical feel to it. The hotel describes a stunning waterview of the ocean or the intracoastal waterway. My view was of the front parking lot and the waterway in the distance and I wasn't impressed. I'd recommend that when you book, ask for the ocean view. The walls were pretty thin and I could here talking and the tv from next door. The plasma tv was large, although I had a few problems with the tv turning on properly and the remote. There was a an overpriced minibar. Bathroom was clean, but a little small.
reviews.title: Skip this overpriced looser

likes.disliked: — Hotels loud music from pool area heard at beach level to room level

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Restaurant: I dined at Baleen for dinner and like other reviewers I felt it was overpriced. My meal was over $70. I dined with a friend and she asked a question regarding an entree and the waiter was rude and arrogant with his response. Afterwards, I felt uncomfortable and just wanted to leave. Needless to say, the next night I ordered room service which was wonderful... quick and friendly service. Next door is the Top of Daytona Restaurant which has a fabulous 360 view of Daytona and more reasonable prices.
reviews.title: Loved the Shores! Daytona... not so much.

likes.liked: — rooms, views, pet policy, fire pit
likes.disliked: — surrounding area is run down, nothing to do in area

reviews.text: Pool/Beach Area: Pool deck was crowded and it was hard finding a spot. Pool was small. Beach area was well-kept and beautiful.
reviews.title: Great beach resort, great food

likes.disliked: — On a rainy day there is not much to do in the area

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I recently stayed at the Shores Resort for 1 night and paid $300. I made my reservation online through Expedia and paid extra for an oceanfront room. I was expecting a balcony where I could sit out and enjoy the view. Unfortunately, not all the oceanfront rooms have balconies. I tried to switch, but was told none were available.
reviews.title: Shores Resort & Spa
Lovely and maybe too chic
reviews.text: Despite that incovenience, I enjoyed my stay at the hotel very much. The rooms are in excellent shape. Very clean, well decorated and comfortable. I especially liked the plasma tv, marble/granite bathroom and comfy bed.
The only thing that I did not like about the room was the shower was not fully enclosed. The glass partition was missing a door and it made a huge puddle in the bathroom floor.
reviews.title: "Heavenly" Absolutely perfect

likes.liked: — Extremely nice place to stay on beach that welcomes pets.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The pool area was nice with poolside bar and towel attendant. Access to the beach/ocean is extremely convenient.
reviews.title: Top drawer for a beach town

reviews.text: We did not eat in the restaurant but did order breakfast from room service. The country egg breakfast was one of the best I have had in recent memory, although pricey.
reviews.title: Going Back in September

reviews.text: We stayed here for 4 nights during Spring Break. We had a river view room and once we got there I tried to upgrade, but they were sold out on Saturday. I didn't book it orginally thinking I would save the $$ instead, but once we saw what the view was like I was so mad at myself. Oh well, live and learn. Plus not all ocean view rooms have a balcony.
reviews.title: Very Stylish yet Not Snobbish

reviews.text: We were very impressed with the size and style of the room. The beds were sooooooo comfortable.
reviews.title: The Best

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel reminded me of a boutique. Very stylish and comfortable. The grounds were amazing. Everything was very clean.
reviews.title: a great hotel

reviews.text: We hung out at the resort every day. The kids loved the ocean as much as the pool area. We were on the beach one day. Another day it was rainy so the kids hung out in the hot tub, which was pretty much all ours. We got a cabana on our last day and enjoyed the comforts of that as well since the pool area got pretty crowded on Saturday. Of course there are your usual pool chair savers. It was nice not to worry about finding a chair since we had a cabana.
reviews.title: Let's get real - not a great experience

description: The Shores Resort & Spa is located on the edge of beautiful Daytona Beach, Florida, both close to the action and away from the action. A short five minute drive from Downtown Daytona Beach, The Shores Resort & Spa is the only AAA Four-Diamond luxury beachfront hotel in Central Florida. Our amenities include waterfront views, balconies, spacious sundeck with swimming pool, Tiki Bar, jacuzzi, beachfront cabanas, and much, much more. The only way to experience the luxury is to visit The Shores Resort & Spa today!
